DOC.brief_summary: Conduct disorder is a group of psychiatric symptoms that can include clinical characteristics of impulsivity and aggressive behavior. This study will investigate the efficacy a safety of oxcarbazepine in the treatment of adolescents with conduct disorder.
DOC.brief_title: The Efficacy and Safety of Oral Oxcarbazepine 300-1200 mg/Day as Adjuvant Therapy in the Treatment of Adolescents With Impulsivity and Aggressive Behavior in Conduct Disorder This Study is Not Being Conducted in the United States.
DOC.criteria: History of conduct disorder, oppositional defiant disorder, and disruptive behavior disorder not otherwise specified Score >8 on the Impulsivity Rating Scale Other serious medical or psychiatric conditions excluding conduct disorder, oppositional defiant disorder, and disruptive behavior disorder not otherwise specified Treatment with antiepileptic medications Other protocoldefined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply.
